      i have no idea

9.30.23  12:18 pm   I need some help with some chord names...
(From bottom to too) Chord 1: Ab Gb B Db Ab

     to be most exact, this would be Bsus2 over Ab. for easier readability, you might say Abmin11, but that doesn't really capture it. my personal short name for this chord is Abmin7sus11, but i wouldn't use that in a chart for someone else without explaining it to them

     
Chord 2: Db B F Bb

     that's a pretty standard way to play Db13

     Chord 3: Gb Eb Ab Db

     how about Gbsus2 6 (you can put the 6 below or above the 2)

     I know the first one is a Ab minor and the second one is a Db dom and the last one is Gb, so what I'm asking is how would I fit in the extensions into the name.

9.30.23  12:44 am   How do I know when it's time for me to stop learning old maths and start making new maths? I feel like I am unable to make new maths after trying hard for a while... because I guess I am not familiar enough with the old maths... But then I try to learn old maths all day long for months, even years on end; and end up feeling like I've forgotten all I've learnt anyway... So then I went back to trying to make new maths and failed again... So I've gone back to learning old maths, but it seems like its going nowhere again... Am I going to be stuck like this forever or will something new come out finally?

      how about learning science

9.28.23  11:20 pm   one cool thing i recently noticed about writing songs as if you're someone else (from a perspective of someone who has had something happened which perhaps hasnt happened to you) as well as while picturing a scene (same situation, you imagine a foreign situation) is that people cna relate even if you havent had the same experience (in a traditional non-imaginary way) they are relating to.

      that's true

9.28.23  4:44 pm   How should we structure?

      that's easy. make everything exactly the same

9.28.23  4:04 pm   How many chord extensions is too many?

     it seems not entirely clear what 'extension' means. it doesn't seem to have any musical meaning. the chord is the chord. 'extension' implies it's different than it was

     Do I use "add4" if there as also a 3 in the chord?

     sure. actually 'add4' tends to mean the 3 is also there. otherwise it's called 'sus4'

     Can I use just the scale degrees in Roman numerals notation for minor?

     if it's minor, you probably should either write "min", "minor", "-", "m", or put the numeral in lowercase. but i'm actually not sure if that many people can read roman numerals nowadays

     Do you like the idea of Am7 G F9maj7 E7(#9),

     seems normal, except the way you notated the F is weird because it looks like it includes Eb and E notes at the same time. it's most likely a notation mistake, considering the rest of the sequence looks common and normal

      and do you like how it sounds?

     it doesn't sound like anything on the page. you'd have to play it somehow

9.28.23  2:44 pm   do you ever have moments when you don't know what song make or select?

      yes. from the beginning of the selection process, all the way up to just before the end of the selection process, i don't know which one to do next. in fact, this uncertainty is the whole reason for the selection process
